actor_awards.notes: A brilliant comedic actress with a reported IQ of 172, she was often typecast as a 'dumb blonde' but brought immense depth and timing to her roles. She won the Academy Award for Best Actress for reprising her Broadway role in Born Yesterday (1950). Her career was tragically cut short by breast cancer at age 43.

filmography.title: Born Yesterday
filmography.role_description: The seemingly dim-witted girlfriend of a corrupt tycoon who learns about democracy and self-respect, turning the tables on her bullying partner.
filmography.plot: A junk tycoon hires a reporter to tutor his girlfriend, but she learns more than he bargained for and begins to question his business practices.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress in a Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy

filmography.title: Adam's Rib
filmography.role_description: A housewife who attempts to shoot her unfaithful husband, sparking a legal battle between married lawyers.
filmography.plot: Domestic and professional tensions rise when a husband and wife work as opposing lawyers in a case involving a woman who shot her husband.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress

filmography.title: Bells Are Ringing
filmography.role_description: A telephone answering service operator who gets too involved in her clients' lives, particularly a struggling playwright.
filmography.plot: An answering service operator gets involved in the lives of her clients, including a playwright with writer's block.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actress in a Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy

filmography.title: It Should Happen to You
filmography.role_description: An unemployed model desperate for fame who rents a billboard in Columbus Circle to display her name.
filmography.plot: A woman seeking fame rents a billboard with her name on it, attracting the attention of a soap manufacturer and a documentary filmmaker.

filmography.title: The Solid Gold Cadillac
filmography.role_description: A naive stockholder who asks embarrassing questions at a board meeting and ends up shaking up a corrupt corporation.
filmography.plot: A minor shareholder in a large corporation takes on the corrupt board of directors and ends up running the company.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actress in a Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy

filmography.title: The Marrying Kind
filmography.role_description: A wife recounting the ups and downs of her marriage to a judge during divorce proceedings.
filmography.plot: A couple on the verge of divorce tells their story to a judge, recalling the tragedies and triumphs of their life together.

filmography.title: Phffft
filmography.role_description: A television writer who divorces her husband only to find that single life isn't what she expected.
filmography.plot: A divorced couple tries to navigate the single life and dating, only to realize they may still be in love with each other.

filmography.title: Full of Life
filmography.role_description: A pregnant woman dealing with her husband's conversion to Catholicism and his overbearing Italian father.
filmography.plot: A writer and his pregnant wife must contend with repairs to their home and the intrusion of his volatile Italian father.

filmography.title: Winged Victory
filmography.role_description: The wife of a pilot trainee in this ensemble war drama based on the Moss Hart play.
filmography.plot: The training and combat experiences of a group of recruits in the US Army Air Forces during World War II.

filmography.title: Something for the Boys
filmography.role_description: An early uncredited bit part as a welder with one line.
filmography.plot: Three cousins inherit a southern plantation and turn it into a home for wives of soldiers stationed nearby.

filmography.title: Greenwich Village
filmography.role_description: An uncredited background role in this Technicolor musical.
filmography.plot: A composer comes to New York in the 1920s to sell his concerto but gets involved with a speakeasy singer.

filmography.title: Too Much Johnson
filmography.role_description: A very early uncredited role in Orson Welles' silent comedy film.
filmography.plot: A slapstick comedy about a playboy who gets mixed up with a jealous husband and flees to Cuba.
